This is a really, really, really common talking point with fascists, okay?  You may hear it a lot in the term the silent majority, you know, the will of the people.  When people don't have a good argument, instead what they defer to is like, hey listen, all these people agree with me, all these people agree with me, look at them, they're all so angry at what you're doing.  You are standing in their way.  So it's a way of sort of deflecting the responsibility.  Instead of answering to you, instead now they're answering to the general public that you've constructed.  It's a really effective tactic.  Populists do it all the time.  I think fascists do it like way more aggressively though.
